debounce_ignore.description: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
debounce_ignore.title: Ignore debounce

disabled.description: Disables the device (excludes device from network scans, availability and group state updates)
disabled.title: Disabled

filtered_attributes.description: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.
filtered_attributes.title: Filtered publish attributes

filtered_cache.description: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.
filtered_cache.title: Filtered attributes from cache

filtered_optimistic.description: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).
filtered_optimistic.title: Filtered optimistic attributes

friendly_name.description: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID
friendly_name.title: Friendly name

name.description: Name of the device in Home Assistant
name.title: Home Assistant name

icon.description: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a full URL link to an image (e.g. https://SOME.SITE/MODEL123.jpg) or a path to a local file inside the `device_icons` directory (e.g. device_icons/MODEL123.png).
icon.title: Icon

qos.description: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device
qos.title: QoS

retain.description: Retain MQTT messages of this device
retain.title: Retain

retention.description: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5
retention.title: Retention

throttle.description: The minimum time between payloads in seconds. Payloads received whilst the device is being throttled will be discarded
throttle.title: Throttle

off_state.description: Control when to publish state OFF or CLOSE for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF/CLOSE when all group members are in state OFF/CLOSE,  'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF
off_state.title: Group off state

qos.description: QoS level for MQTT messages of this group
qos.title: QoS

adapter_concurrent.description: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
adapter_concurrent.title: Adapter concurrency

cache_state.description: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant
cache_state.title: Cache state

cache_state_persistent.description: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
cache_state_persistent.title: Persist cache state

cache_state_send_on_startup.description: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
cache_state_send_on_startup.title: Send cached state on startup

channel.description: Zigbee channel, changing might require re-pairing some devices! (Note: use a ZLL channel: 11, 15, 20, or 25 to avoid problems)
channel.title: ZigBee channel

elapsed.description: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
elapsed.title: Elapsed

ext_pan_id.description: Zigbee extended pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
ext_pan_id.title: Ext Pan ID

last_seen.description: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
last_seen.title: Last seen

log_debug_namespace_ignore.description: Do not log these namespaces (regex-based) for debug level
log_debug_namespace_ignore.title: Log debug namespace ignore

log_debug_to_mqtt_frontend.description: Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (may decrease overall performance)
log_debug_to_mqtt_frontend.title: Log debug to MQTT and frontend

log_directories_to_keep.description: Number of log directories to keep before deleting the oldest one
log_directories_to_keep.title: Number of past log folders to keep

log_file.description: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
log_file.title: Log file

log_namespaced_levels.description: Set individual log levels for certain namespaces
log_namespaced_levels.title: Log Namespaced Levels

log_output.description: Output location of the log, leave empty to suppress logging
log_output.title: Log output

log_symlink_current.description: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
log_symlink_current.title: Log symlink current

app_name.description: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).
app_name.title: Localhost

eol.description: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).
eol.title: eol

host.description: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
host.title: Host

localhost.description: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
localhost.title: Localhost

path.description: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
path.title: Path

pid.description: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
pid.title: PID

port.description: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
port.title: Port

protocol.description: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
protocol.title: Protocol

type.description: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
type.title: Type

network_key.description: Network encryption key, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
network_key.title: Network key

output.description: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
output.title: MQTT output type

pan_id.description: ZigBee pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
pan_id.title: Pan ID

transmit_power.description: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
transmit_power.title: Transmit power

backoff.description: Enable timeout backoff on failed availability pings (x1.5, x3, x6, x12...)
backoff.title: Backoff

max_jitter.description: Maximum jitter (in msec) allowed on timeout to avoid availability pings trying to trigger around the same time
max_jitter.title: Max jitter

pause_on_backoff_gt.description: Pause availability pings when backoff reaches over this limit until a new Zigbee message is received from the device. A value of zero disables pausing.
pause_on_backoff_gt.title: Pause on backoff greater than

timeout.description: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
timeout.title: Timeout

passive.description: Options for passive devices (mostly battery powered)

timeout.description: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
timeout.title: Timeout

passive.title: Passive

blocklist.description: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
blocklist.title: Blocklist

device_options.title: Options that are applied to all devices

base_url.description: Base URL for the frontend. If hosted under a subpath, e.g. 'http://localhost:8080/z2m', set this to '/z2m'
base_url.title: Base URL

disable_ui_serving.description: If true, the frontend UI is not served, only the WebSocket is maintained by Zigbee2MQTT (you are required to serve a standalone UI yourself as needed).
disable_ui_serving.title: Disable UI serving

host.description: Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix socket when an absolute path is given instead.
host.title: Bind host

notification_filter.description: Hide frontend notifications matching specified regex strings. Example: 'z2m: Failed to ping.*'
notification_filter.title: Notification Filter

port.description: Frontend binding port. Ignored when using a unix domain socket
port.title: Port

ssl_cert.description: SSL Certificate file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
ssl_cert.title: Certificate file path

ssl_key.description: SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
ssl_key.title: key file path

url.description: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page
url.title: URL

health.description: Periodically check the health of Zigbee2MQTT

reset_on_check.description: If true, will reset stats every time the health check is executed (only applicable to stats that can be reset).
reset_on_check.title: Reset on check

health.title: Health

experimental_event_entities.description: Home Assistant experimental event entities, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add event entities for exposed actions. The events and attributes are currently deemed experimental and subject to change.
experimental_event_entities.title: Home Assistant experimental event entities

legacy_action_sensor.description: Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, when enabled a action sensor will be discoverd and an empty `action` will be send after every published action.
legacy_action_sensor.title: Home Assistant legacy action sensors

base_topic.description: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
base_topic.title: Base topic

ca.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
ca.title: Certificate authority

cert.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
cert.title: SSL/TLS certificate

force_disable_retain.description: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if your MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
force_disable_retain.title: Force disable retain

include_device_information.description: Include device information to mqtt messages
include_device_information.title: Include device information

key.description: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
key.title: SSL/TLS key

maximum_packet_size.description: Specifies the maximum allowed packet length (in bytes) that the server can send to Zigbee2MQTT. NOTE: The same value exists in your MQTT broker but for the length the client can send to it instead.
maximum_packet_size.title: Maximum packet size

server.description: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
server.title: MQTT server

default_maximum_data_size.description: The size of file chunks sent during an update (in bytes). Note: This value may get ignored for manufacturers that require specific values.
default_maximum_data_size.title: Default maximum data size

disable_automatic_update_check.description: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
disable_automatic_update_check.title: Disable automatic update check

image_block_response_delay.description: Limits the rate of requests (in milliseconds) during OTA updates to reduce network congestion. You can increase this value if your network appears unstable during OTA.
image_block_response_delay.title: Image block response delay

update_check_interval.description: Your device may request a check for a new firmware update. This value determines how frequently third party servers may actually be contacted to look for firmware updates. The value is set in minutes, and the default is 1 day.
update_check_interval.title: Update check interval

zigbee_ota_override_index_location.description: Location of override OTA index file
zigbee_ota_override_index_location.title: OTA index override file name

passlist.description: Allow only certain devices to join the network (by ieeeAddr). Note that all devices not on the passlist will be removed from the network!
passlist.title: Passlist

adapter.description: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems
adapter.title: Adapter

baudrate.description: Baud rate speed for the serial port. This must match what the firmware on your adapter supports (most commonly 115200).
baudrate.title: Baudrate

disable_led.description: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
disable_led.title: Disable led

port.description: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null
port.title: Port

rtscts.description: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
rtscts.title: RTS / CTS
